Service Level Objectives (SLO)

← Back to Documentation

Overview

Service Level Objectives (SLOs) define the reliability and performance targets for Pez Solutions services. These objectives help set expectations and guide operational decisions to ensure consistent service quality.

Uptime Targets

Primary SLO: 99.9% Uptime

  • Target: 99.9% uptime
  • Allowable Downtime: ~44 minutes per month
  • Measurement Period: Monthly rolling window
  • Measurement: Continuous monitoring and alerting
  • Reporting: Monthly uptime reports

Downtime Breakdown

Time Period Maximum Allowable Downtime
Per Month 43 minutes 49 seconds
Per Week 10 minutes 4 seconds
Per Day 1 minute 26 seconds
Per Year 8 hours 45 minutes

Performance Targets

Web Services

  • Response Time: <200ms for web services
  • Page Load Time: <2 seconds for full page load
  • API Response Time: <100ms for API calls
  • Error Rate: <0.1% of requests

Media Streaming

  • Streaming Quality: 1080p minimum, 4K when possible
  • Transcoding Time: Real-time or faster for standard content
  • Buffer Time: <5 seconds for stream start
  • Streaming Reliability: <1% stream interruptions

Storage Services

  • File Access: Sub-second file access for web interface
  • Upload Speed: Limited by user's connection, not server
  • Download Speed: Sustained 100+ Mbps when possible
  • Sync Performance: <10 seconds for file synchronization

Service-Specific SLOs

Service Uptime Target Performance Target Recovery Time
Plex Media Server 99.9% Stream start <5s <15 minutes
Jellyfin Media Server 99.9% Stream start <5s <15 minutes
Private Cloud Drive 99.9% File access <1s <30 minutes
Public File Hosting 99.9% Download start <2s <15 minutes
Web Services 99.9% Page load <2s <10 minutes

Monitoring & Measurement

SLOs are continuously monitored using a comprehensive observability stack:

  • Uptime Monitoring: External monitoring services check service availability
  • Performance Monitoring: Application performance monitoring (APM) tools
  • Infrastructure Monitoring: Server resources and health metrics
  • User Experience Monitoring: Real user monitoring (RUM) data
  • Alerting: Automated alerts when SLOs are at risk

Recovery Procedures

Automated Recovery

  • Health Checks: Automated service health monitoring
  • Auto-Restart: Automatic service restart on failure
  • Failover: Automatic failover to backup systems
  • Load Balancing: Traffic routing away from failed components

Manual Recovery

  • Incident Response: Documented procedures for manual intervention
  • Escalation: Clear escalation paths for critical issues
  • Communication: User notification procedures
  • Post-Incident: Root cause analysis and improvements

Recovery Time Objectives (RTO)

  • Critical Services: <15 minutes
  • Standard Services: <30 minutes
  • Data Recovery: <4 hours for critical data
  • Full System Recovery: <24 hours

Planned Maintenance

Scheduled maintenance is designed to minimize impact on SLOs:

  • Maintenance Windows: Low-usage periods (typically 2-4 AM GMT)
  • Advance Notice: 48-72 hours notice for planned maintenance
  • Rolling Updates: Zero-downtime updates where possible
  • Rollback Plans: Quick rollback procedures if issues arise

Error Budgets

Error budgets define how much unreliability is acceptable within SLO targets:

Monthly Error Budget (99.9% SLO)

  • Total Budget: 43 minutes 49 seconds
  • Planned Maintenance: Up to 30 minutes
  • Unplanned Outages: Up to 13 minutes 49 seconds
  • Budget Tracking: Real-time consumption monitoring

Budget Management

  • 50% Budget Used: Increased monitoring and caution
  • 75% Budget Used: Freeze on risky changes
  • 90% Budget Used: Focus entirely on reliability
  • 100% Budget Used: SLO breach, post-incident review

Reporting & Transparency

Regular reporting ensures transparency and accountability:

  • Monthly Reports: Detailed SLO performance reports
  • Incident Reports: Root cause analysis for major incidents
  • Trend Analysis: Performance trends and improvement areas
  • Public Status: Real-time status page for service health

Exceptions & Exclusions

The following events are excluded from SLO calculations:

  • Scheduled Maintenance: Pre-announced maintenance windows
  • Force Majeure: Natural disasters, power outages, ISP issues
  • DDoS Attacks: External attacks beyond reasonable protection
  • Client-Side Issues: User's internet connection or device problems
  • Third-Party Dependencies: Failures of external services we depend on

Continuous Improvement

SLOs are regularly reviewed and improved:

  • Quarterly Reviews: SLO target assessment and adjustment
  • Performance Analysis: Regular analysis of performance trends
  • User Feedback: Incorporating user experience feedback
  • Technology Updates: Infrastructure improvements to meet SLOs

Contact & Support

For questions about SLOs or to report service issues, contact support@pez.solutions.

For real-time service status, visit the Pez Solutions Status Page (when available).
